relatedBlades.title: Help us build a better Internet
relatedBlades.copy: At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal — to help build a better Internet. We believe that with our talented team, smart technology and engaged users we can solve some of the biggest problems on the Internet. Just how big?

relatedBlades.title: What we do
relatedBlades.copy:
- Anytime we push code, it automatically affects millions of Internet properties.
- Every day, thousands of new customers sign up for Cloudflare service.
- We serve %{HTTPRequests} million HTTP requests per second on average.
- We serve data from %{DataCenterCount} cities in over %{CountryCount} countries around the world.

image.description: Photo of employees at their laptops

features.title: SASE and SSE
features.description: Connect and secure your employees, contractors, devices, networks, apps, and data everywhere they live. Deliver Internet-native Zero Trust security and simplify your journey to unified SSE or SASE.

features.title: Fast app delivery and network infrastructure
features.description: Give your digital products and services top-notch security, reliability, and performance for customers everywhere. Reduce risk with built-in threat intelligence drawn from proxying ~20% of the web.

features.title: Full-stack development
features.description: Easily build and deploy full-stack applications everywhere, thanks to integrated compute, storage, and networking. Skip time-wasting development steps and improve  productivity with services that scale automatically.

relatedBlades.title: Our story
relatedBlades.copy: Cloudflare started as a simple application to find the source of email spam. From there it grew into a service that protects websites from all manner of attacks, while simultaneously optimizing performance.

image.description: Photo of Matthew Prince and Michelle Zatlyn at TechCrunch

relatedBlades.title: Our IPO
relatedBlades.copy: Cloudflare's global cloud platform delivers a range of network services to businesses of all sizes around the world—making them more secure while enhancing the performance and reliability of their critical Internet properties. On 13 September 2019, Cloudflare made its debut on the public market as it rang the bell at the New York Stock Exchange and became a publicly traded company (NYSE: NET).

image.description: Photo of Cloudflare IPO at NYSE

relatedBlades.title: Meet the team
relatedBlades.copy: While we are still an engineering company at our core, we need passionate people in all areas of our company. From sales, support, marketing, to business development, we're always looking for valuable team members that want to make a difference and meaningful impact on the Internet.
relatedBlades.button1Text: Take a look at our open positions

image.description: Photo of a man and a woman standing with laptops
